com.stormpath.sdk.provider.social

Interface UserInfoMappingRule

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MappingRule
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultUserInfoMappingRule

    public interface UserInfoMappingRule
extends MappingRule
    A rule that indicates how a userInfo attribute from a Social Provider should populate one or more Stormpath Account field values. By creating rules, you configure which userInfo attribute values from the Social Provider should be copied to Stormpath Account field values.

    UserInfoMappingRules are immutable. If you want to change the mapping rules for Accounts in a particular Social Directory, you must remove and add new UserInfoMappingRule instances to the Directory Provider's UserInfoMappingRules instance.

    How does it work?

    Each UserInfoMappingRule has a name and a collection of Stormpath account attribute names.

    When a userInfo attribute from a Social Provider is encountered, every userInfo attribute from the Social Provider with a matching name will have its value copied to the corresponding specified Stormpath account fields.

    Example

    For example, assume that a mapping rule's name is foo, and the rule's accountAttributes collection contains the Stormpath Account field names of givenName and surname.

    If a userInfo attribute named foo is encountered on login to have a value of bar, then bar will automatically be copied to the specified Stormpath Account fields for that user. This user would then automatically have a givenName of bar and a surname of bar.

    Since:
    1.3.0

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface com.stormpath.sdk.provider.MappingRule

        getAccountAttributes, getName
